dt: {bc}a slender medical instrument used especially for exploration (as of a wound or body cavity)
{bc}any of various testing devices or substances: such as
{bc}a pointed metal tip for making electrical contact with a circuit element being checked
{bc}a usually small object that is inserted into something so as to test conditions at a given point
{bc}a device used to penetrate or send back information especially from outer space or a celestial body
{bc}a device (such as an ultrasound generator) or a substance (such as radioactively labeled DNA) used to obtain specific information for diagnostic or experimental purposes
{bc}a pipe on the receiving airplane thrust into the drogue of the delivering airplane in air refueling

shortdef: a slender medical instrument used especially for exploration (as of a wound or body cavity)
any of various testing devices or substances: such as
a pointed metal tip for making electrical contact with a circuit element being checked

dt: {bc}to search into and explore very thoroughly {bc}subject to a penetrating investigation

pt: {sc}enter{/sc} {sc}penetrate{/sc} {sc}pierce{/sc} {sc}probe{/sc} mean to make way into something. {sc}enter{/sc} is the most general of these and may imply either going in or forcing a way in.
{sc}penetrate{/sc} carries a strong implication of an impelling force or compelling power that achieves entrance.
{sc}pierce{/sc} means an entering or cutting through with a sharp pointed instrument.
{sc}probe{/sc} implies penetration to investigate or explore something hidden from sight or knowledge.

shortdef: to search into and explore very thoroughly : subject to a penetrating investigation
to make a searching exploratory investigation

dt: {bc}a microprobe that uses an electron beam to induce X-ray emissions in a sample

shortdef: a microprobe that uses an electron beam to induce X-ray emissions in a sample

dt: {bc}a device that is used to obtain information from outer space and send it back to Earth

shortdef: a device that is used to obtain information from outer space and send it back to Earth
